intro: Taraxacum platycranum, commonly known as the broad-crown dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, spoon-shaped leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a sphere of white pappus-tipped seeds. The plant belongs to the dandelion genus within the Asteraceae family, known for its medicinal and ecological significance. Its hairy stems and alternate leaf arrangement are notable botanical features. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens.
